meanings.sent1: The group of friends had an antiaristocratic view, believing everyone should be equal.
meanings.sent2: Her antiaristocratic beliefs led her to advocate for fair treatment of all social classes.
meanings.sent3: The antiaristocratic cat refused to acknowledge the hierarchy of the neighborhood felines.
meanings.sent4: The antiaristocratic storm raged on, tearing down the barriers of privilege and power.
meanings.sent5: The antiaristocratic flag symbolized the fight against elitism and inequality.

meanings.definition: Not supporting or favoring aristocratic rule or class.
meanings.sent1: The antiaristocratic movement gained momentum as more people rejected the old aristocratic ways.
meanings.sent2: His antiaristocratic stance made him unpopular among the nobility.
meanings.sent3: The antiaristocratic squirrel refused to hoard nuts like the other squirrels in the park.
meanings.sent4: The antiaristocratic river flowed freely, not bound by the constraints of the ruling class.
meanings.sent5: The antiaristocratic revolution brought about a new era of equality and fairness.
